content.body: If anyone is familiar with Haskell, Scheme (R6RS or R5RS/R7RS), Common Lisp, or the GNU Multiple Precision Arithmetic Library, then Iâ€™d love if they would glance at https://github.com/js-choi/proposal-popcount/blob/main/README.md#description and double-check that the behavior column is correct for that language/library.
jschoi: My CL impl (SBCL) is *not* using 2s complement. I'm not sure *what* it's using, since `(logcount -1)` returns 0

Thanks for looking! And, yeah, I need to note that itâ€™s counting the zero bits of the 8-bit twoâ€™s complement and rolling over beyond 8 bits.

At leastâ€¦I *think* thatâ€™s whatâ€™s going on. `(logcount 255)` and `(logcount -256)` is 8, and `(logcount 256)` and `(logcount 257)` is 1, according to whatever implementation https://www.tutorialspoint.com/execute_lisp_online.php is using.
